I switched to these after years of using similar priced and designed (as far as I can tell) Sony earbuds.The noise cancelling seems a little less pronounced than on similar Sony earbuds I have used (may not be a bad thing) and does not deal with wind noise as well (not a good thing), but overall works pretty well for dampening non-wind background noise.  The overall sound quality is adequate for my main use-cases - listening to podcasts and books and doing phone calls and video conferences. If I were more focused on listening to music, I'd want something better and I think the Sony ones were a bit better.The headphones often disconnect from Bluetooth when I'm walking around; sometimes they reconnect within about 3-7 seconds; other times I need to do this manually.  That is frustrating but quickly solved. I have not had the problem with the JBL headphones that repeatedly occurred with several sets of Sony earbuds I had, where the left earbud would refuse for hours, days or "forever' to connect to Bluetooth. Repeatedly facing that issue with several iterations of Sony earbuds (which I otherwise liked and think were better than these JBL earbuds) is what caused me to give up on Sony and give JBL a try.The headphones stay in my ears during exercise and through sweating and bouncing around.  So far, I'm happy with the battery life.

Updating my review: I have now used these on an airplane and they were incredible. The noise cancellation was so effective I could keep my volume lower and my ears feel much better. Still love them.Original review: I pre-ordered these to replace my aging JLB earbuds and I have been so pleased with them. The noise cancelling is like nothing I've ever experienced. I walk in the gym, it's loud in there (big chain gym). Once I turn on the noise cancellation (I use the functional training setting) WHOOSH, all of a sudden, all I can hear is my music. It's incredible. And these things can hold a charge like nothing else. They are very sweat proof. The sound quality is amazing, my music sounds so much better on these than my old earbuds. Getting a fit was easy and they stay in place all workout long, whether I'm lifting, on the elliptical or even doing aerobics. I love the customizable controls for taps. Everything about these is customizable! And they are also ready out of the box. Truly a great investment. With the noise cancelling I can keep the volume lower and it makes my ears feel much better. I do recommend if it's your first time with active noise cancelling (ANC), read up on what it does first. There's a good NYT article on it. All I can hear in the gym with ANC on full is clanking from weights, which is high frequency sound. The low frequency roar of treadmills and the vacuum them are always running is gone once I turn ANC on. Highly recommend, absolutely love them and a great value for the money.
They stay in my ear and have great sound. Love that they had color options. Definitely recommend.

product_name: JBL Endurance Race 2 - Waterproof (IP68) Sports True Wireless Earbuds with 4 mics for Crisp, Clear Calls, JBL Pure Bass Sound, 48Hrs of Playback, Plus Speed Charging & Active Noise Cancelling (White)

reviews.review: Quite happy with these. After my beloved Pixel Buds started failing I had a hard time finding something that was a) as secure and comfortable in-ear as the Buds and 2) would allow me to hear ambient sounds like the Buds. These fit the bill just right.They have a little winglet on the earpiece like the Buds, and the same twist-to-lock design. They are quite secure in your ear without being uncomfortable. I thought the size would be an issue, bouncing around or something, but I barely notice them. The size IS an issue when cycling though, as the wind noise they generate is distracting on downhill bits.The battery life is remarkable. After a 50 minute ride I still had 97% battery. Nuts. I bet these would last a full workday.Sound quality is quite good. Vocals are clear and crisp, deep bass hits nicely, though it might be lacking a bit at mids and mid-bass. I'm quite pleased. These would be excellent if you do a lot of podcasts.I didn't want ANC because, again, I want to be aware of my surroundings when I work out, but the Ambient Awareness mode in these does it's advertised job nicely. Full ANC isn't going to be on the level of a Bose Quietcomfort, but it's pretty adequate. Time will tell if these do the job on an airplane. For working out though, I don't WANT a Quietcomfort--I need to have some spacial awareness, and these do that job well.I rate these 9/10 for the job they're designed for (workouts). For the $49 I paid for them, that's remarkable.

Fantastic purchase! Sound quality is as good or better than my AirPod Pros, but these are more customizable with regard to the sound output (Bass, Rock, Club, vocal, Jazz, etc) and other settings. They were very easy to set up and connect to my IPhone.  They are comfortable to wear and don’t fall out easily. I’ll be using these solely for my hikes since the battery life along with the additional battery life in the case makes it a no-brainer! Case is not as small as the apple version, but feels like quality material.

So far, so good! I’ve been holding onto my JBL x Under Armor earbuds for YEARS (absolute favorite ever, hands down. Devastated they don’t make them anymore) and have been dreading having to find a decent replacement. So far, these have almost exactly the same sound quality, so I’m very impressed! No connectivity issues at all. I’ve always struggled to find ear buds that fit my ear shape, but these fit perfectly. I really hope I’m able to get the same length of use out of these as my other ones.

product_name: JBL Quantum TWS AIR - True Wireless Gaming Earbuds with Smart Ambient Technology, Low Latency 2.4GHz USB-C dongle or Bluetooth, 4 beamforming Microphones (Black)

reviews.review: First Thing: UPDATE these ear buds. You need to do it TWICE! Get the JBL app for your phone and software update the buds, then get the JBL Quantum Engine App for PC (or Mac) and do the firmware update. Before the updates I could only get one bud/channel to work with Android using the dongle, and after the updates both buds work. So far I have tested the USB-C Dongle with PC, Steam Deck, iPad, and Android - it works well with all devices listed providing low latency, and high(er) fidelity, sound. I tested multiple games on Steam Deck, including Hi-Fi Rush (a rhythm game), and had no latency issues. The Dongle is true plug and play (no setup needed) on every device except PC. Plugging in the USB-C Dongle prompted a download of Quantum Engine, and inside the QE app you can set EQ and tweak the Surround Sound settings. I tested the buds in Battlefield V on PC and the surround sound worked well. Adjusting the EQ in the QE app on PC is easy and necessary in order to get the most pleasing sound. The only device I’m using Bluetooth with is my Android phone and the sound is fine - use the JBL app to adjust the EQ. The Android App offers a FULL EQ, not the typical/lame EQ for dummies a lot of ear bud devices ship with.I’ve only had the JBL Quantum TWS Airs (that name lol) for a short time, so I can’t offer a comprehensive review yet. I will say they are very light and fit well in my ears. There is no wing, or stabilizer, so these might not be great for active on-the-go situations. The stock EQ needed a tweak for my ears, and the Apps make that easy. The sound quality via the USB-C Dongle is a noticeable upgrade in terms of latency and fidelity. These are better for music than I anticipated, and from reviews I read this is one of the big differences from the more expensive, and older version, of this line of Quantum TWS buds. Battery life is much shorter using the Dongle, and that makes sense as the low latency signal is more power hungry than Bluetooth. I spent some time looking for low latency wireless ear buds and this is one the most affordable options out there ($40 on sale). Hopefully in time more companies will offer similar low latency earbuds, or maybe Bluetooth will get good enough to make a product like this irrelevant.

Got these for $50 new in box marked as "used". The sound quality is great. I use them for the gym and for gaming. Im very competitive so im sensitive to latency and these have none that i can notice. They do get uncomfortable after long gaming sessions but most earbuds do that in my ears. Battery life could be better. They last around 4-5 hours with ANC enabled, with it off I'm not sure but definitely a lot longer than 5 hrs. They also look nice, not gamery or bulky.

They have an excellent sound quality, the ANC works pretty well and it's also adaptative, I'm not a fan of a talk-through function I think it's best to just pause your music.The headphones are pretty comfortable and fit perfectly for my ear, the battery life is very good too. The case is a little too big for carrying it on a pocket but still can fit. It charges pretty fast too and I appreciate that.The voice assistant is very useful, it can read and answer message and read u all your notifications. Also control smart home devices which I use a lot.Only problem with it is that the dongle doesn't work very well with other smartphones or tablets, I read that the Pc firmware update can fix that but my Pc doesn't have a usb-c port and I haven't been able to buy an adapter (and it can't connect to the pc app by Bluetooth for some reason).Definitely a good purchase still just for it's in-app customization, voice assistant features and sound quality.

So I bought these earbuds on discount for $75 on Black Friday, and I want to share some thoughts I have about this thing.1. It's not exactly perfectly low latency. I play rhythm games a lot, and I do notice a slight amount of latency even with the "low latency" dongle mode. I've tried disabling any audio processing on Windows, but it's still the same. The latency is fairly low given that it's wireless. You'll be hard pressed to notice for other games like Valorant, but there's just a touch of latency which prevents me from using it for rhythm games in particular.2. Audio is pretty good. Very bass heavy as you'd expect, but there is an EQ so you can change it around. Once you balance it out with the EQ I think the audio quality is quite exceptional for these buds.3. Battery life is mid. When you use it in low-latency mode the battery dies in around 3-4 hours without ANC or processing. Probably take off an hour if you had it on. The bluetooth mode lasts for much longer, I'd peg it around 6 hours (although I've never fully drained it in bluetooth yet).4. Charging is fairly fast for both the case and the earbuds.5. There are some strange audio artifacts (glitching and occasionally choppy audio) with the dongle. This happens very occasionally, and I've tried disabling interference like from Wi-Fi and other 2.4Ghz accessories but it still occurs.6. I think the touch controls are hard to learn. The one for switching modes is fairly straightforward, but pairing, switching, and learning play/pause is not intuitive.7. Noise cancellation is quite weak compared to many other earbuds on the market, similar with the "transparency mode" on these things. Talk-thru actually is OK, but sounds artificial and you can definitely tell the noise from outside is piped in.8. They sit comfortably in the ears and don't feel like they're gonna fall out. However, at least for me, they get uncomfortable over like 1 hour of wearing.Overall, given the discounted $75 price I think they're a great pair of buds, better than other $99 Bluetooth buds on the market. At the original $150, there are much better options (without low latency dongle).And gamers beware, if you are planning to use these for latency critical audio tasks, these are NOT for you. Stick to wired or look for something else. These get quite close but I still notice a tad bit of audio latency.

product_name: JBL Endurance Peak 3 - Dust and Water Proof (IP68) True Wireless Active Earbuds, JBL Pure Bass Sound, Up to 50 Total Hours of Playback with Speed Charge, Ambient Aware & Talk Thru (Blue)

reviews.review: These are great! Good base and sound quality, you can choose presets or adjust the sound settings directly in the app. The microphone is pretty strong too, I drive big trucks for work and it's really noisy in the cab, other headphones I've used struggle to hear what I'm saying when using voice prompts for siri or Gemini but not one issue yet (when prompting with the earbuds). I've used them in the shower, at the gym, even in the sauna and they still work really good. In the app you can set the touch buttons to do nothing so you're not interrupting music or anything. Pretty good battery life, comfortable for long term wear, has a really good ambient mode to be able to hear what's going on around you, worth the money id say.***In the shower before I figured out the touch button thing I put the ear buds down while I washed my hair, water got into the ear bud holes, they still worked but the right one sounded a tad bit weird, put em in rice for 24hrs just case and no problems

I was looking for new earphones specifically for fitness with the main usage test being running. I wanted to test across several price points to see which would be most worth the money. I've only had cheap running earphones before (though I have nicer cans that I use to listen with in other scenarios and some nice wired in ears for when I perform live). I don't really care about noise cancelling. My primary criteria were about comfort (and if it can stay in my ear while running), and the sound quality vs price (how much marginal return do I get per dollar). I ended up picking a premium pair because you can really notice how much more digital/fake the audio sounds when testing side by side, the lower down in price you go.(note: a lot of what I put were just notes I was jotting down while testing them. I try to do a more succinct summary in the first line of each option, and then it gets more rambly/random after that)In the running:Sony WF-1000XM4 $189.00 | Beats Fit Pro - $179 | Power Beats Pro - $179 | Jabra Elite 4 Active - $89 | JBL Endurance Peak 3 - $89.95 | Soundcore Sport X10 - $69.99 | JLab JBuds Air Sport - $69.88 | Golrex $29.99 | BMani  T16 $39.99Here are my thoughts:Power Beats Pro - $179 (149) - My winner overallSounds great. It is not the best sound I've heard in earphones, but doesn't seem to lack anything. Has good thumpy bass, presence in the mids, and good clarity up high. Nothing to complain about the sound.Big/heavy case (doesn't matter that much, but I do take these on big hikes so smaller case would have been nicer)I think ultimately will be more comfortable for long use than the Fit pro. The stock medium tips fit fine, unlike the fit pro for some reason.Sounds essentially the exact same as the fit pro which makes senseBeats Fit Pro - $179I wanted this to be my favorite. It's light, small, has fun color options, and sounds great. But it ultimately was just not comfortable enough to leave in my ears for longer than 45 minutes. This would vary from person to person obviously.Pretty comfortable, but had to switch to the small eartips (only earbuds I had to switch from the medium/stock tips). Stays in the ears well, but I think that the whole thing being in there will get uncomfortable pushing my ears after a while. Really little case which is nice.Really great clarity, feels perfectCan't find any eq in the app, but I didn't feel the need to adjust any eq settings either, every band/frequency was very satisfying, so that's kind of nice not having to set it myselfSony WF-1000XM4 $189.00I believe this has a slightly fuller sound quality to it. Can't really pinpoint how or why, but seems to be the most superior sound quality of all of them. I thought it might be better bass but that's not it. I can't pick a part any individual component that seem superior, it just has an overall fuller soundThere just doesn't seem to be any way that these are going to stay in during a run. Would be great for any non-exercise application, but just wasn't what I was looking for. I would choose these if I were looking for just walk around town kind of  earbuds.Jabra Elite 4 Active - $89Great clarity and bass out of the box. I am the kind of guy who can only really tell sound differences when a/b testing it. If I only listened to these earbuds, I would have been fully satisfied with the sound quality, the comfort, and the security. It's only because I tested it next to the premium models above that I decided not to go with this. But if this is your budget range, these are definitely the winners.Excessively comfortable, like the most comfortable of any of the earbuds (premiums included), and feel like they will stay in on a run even though they don't have any sort of little hook like the soundcore or powerbeats, or over ear hook like the others. Definitely the best ergonomics. Would take this over the JBL endurance or any other in the sub $150 price range.Soundcore Sport X10 - $69.99more satisfying for non edm music than the other options down below. Better separation for instruments and vocals.Compared against JLabs with blue tips in, the bass is more comparable. Soundcore keeps more clarity than on higher end (albeit a little tinny sounding), than JLabsBass is definitely much better than JLabs. It does feel a bit more muddy because of the heavier bass, there may have been better vocal clarity with JLabsEverything else seems fineANC is decentsmall profile is light, really comfortable and stays in the earsJLab JBuds Air Sport - $69.88bigger profile, slightly less comfortable than the Soundcore. Bass is lacking out of the box. There's better mid and high clarity on these than the soundcore.Bass improves a noticeable amount by switching to blue tips, but you lose some clarity higher upbass feels punchier in edm in these than x10These are definitely more satisfying for thumpy edm music than the x10The sound quality just feels lacking in depth, no matter which eq setting you choose.Has a connected usb charger on the case as a charger (rather than a separate chord to plug into both charger and power), which I don't think I likeJBL Endurance Peak 3 - $89.95Clear vocals and instruments in mids and highs. Slightly more clear and crisp than the soundcoreNice bass as well, (slightly worse bass than soundcore), less satisfying than the sound core on lyrical song but actually has punchier bass on edmPlenty loud (other reviews saying they don't get loud)The equalizer app gives lots of controlThis bass is also superior once equalized. So both bass and instrumental/vocals have more clarity. After messing with eq, is better than soundcore.This sounded perfectly fine until compared with higher tier, then when a/b compared it sounded a bit more fake, a bit more digital, definitely enough to notice a differenceGolrex $29.99It is okay sound, probably the best in this price range. If you just want something cheap that will give you sound, these are fine. If you care about sound quality even a little bit, it's worth it to get a better headset.There is no clarity at any frequency, just a decent amount of noise.Has an attempted cheap premium look with led interfaces.BMani  T16 $39.99Sounds way below average, worse than the golrex.Really similar packaging and look to the golrex, so they're either just copying each other or made by the same people

Really good earbuds. Volume max is a little lower than I would prefer. Bass is good enough. They do not fall out.No fuether updates on this review as they were sadly stolen 3 months after purchase. My short time with them was good though! A bitter ending to a good story.Don't let them out of your sight :)

These are amazing.  Sound quality is fantastic and the app integration is legit.  I do kinda wish they had volume controls but other than that they are perfect for running.  They are heavy and stay in place securely wrapped around the ear with minimal jostling while running.  Worth the money, however, I did get them for 40% off so like 60 bucks which is not a bad amount for such a solid piece of equipment.  The charging case is sturdy and solid.  Feels and looks sleek and modern.  Absolutely love them.  If you are tired of crappy headphones that wear out quickly, fall out, or are just cheap, check these out.  You won’t be disappointed, I’m not.  😊

product_name: JBL Vibe Buds - True Wireless Earbuds, Smart Ambient, VoiceAware, Up to 32 total hours of battery life with speed charging, Water and dust resistant, JBL Deep Bass Sound (Black)

reviews.review: The headphones fit perfectly while also having really good bass and sound quality. But out of the box the sound is a little funky but after 5 minutes of use it returns back to normal and while getting really good sound quality and also have slot of battery life. I have been using them all day and it only got to around 80 percent on the JBL APP

I had to write this review after losing my old iOS Pro Buds and needing a new pair. These JBL Vibe Buds were on sale for $30, and I expected just okay for the price. But they’re amazing value. JBL has built solid products for years, and these are no exception. For $30, the sound is fantastic, and they stay in my ears without any issue—the default fit out of the box was perfect, and they arrived fully charged.The QR code for the JBL app is a nice touch, offering easy access to different sound settings. I’m an AI music creator, and these buds deliver some of the best sound I’ve heard, even compared to more expensive options.If I ever lose them again, I’ll definitely be buying another pair. Highly recommended

These work great, sound good, link up to Bluetooth easily.  But if you have them in your pocket or backpack and they separate from the charger, they can run out of battery, get lost or dirty.  I would highly recommend these for casual use.

These are eliteee, so basically yall im a gym girly and i usually go to the gym with my airpod pros but i left them somewhere and for someone who listens to music at work and etc i need to replace them quick, these are better than airpods!!! Bass is great, sound is clean, and they’re LOUD 10/10 get them also they dont have a top so that’s weird

This product is exceptionally excellent,  ive had this exactly a year to this date, amd ive had this in the toughest weather condition possible, and still functioning as new, great quality sound, I mean this things is excellent.  Love this high recommend this over any apple pods

DO NOT BUY THESE.These have been a problem from the start. The first pair I got, the audio squeaked and dropped every few seconds. They would barely work with Apple products, and they'd work okay with Microsoft products. I submitted for an exchange or refund WITHIN DAYS OF RECEIVING THEM, and Amazon rejected both. I then contacted JBL and started the process over. I very clearly explained that I had done all of the trouble shooting possible. I was told to try the troubleshooting again, as there was no other option. I told them I wasn't going to waste my time, and that they needed to make it right. I got no reply.A week later I got an email requesting a review of my service, HILARIOUS. I let them know I received a defective product and was ignored by both Amazon and JBL. I told them you're welcome for the free money.I immediately got a reply apologizing and information to return the defective products, as well as a tracking number for the replacement pair.Unfortunately, the new pair has the same issues, although not as severely. I decided to keep them because wasn't interesting in spending more time begging to get what I'm owed. Aside from the audio issues, the casing on these have begun to chip off. These headphones sit on my desk all day. They do not get jostled inside of a bag or moved around whatsoever.I've had these second pair almost a year, and now they work even less then the original pair did. I'm going to go to the gas station and buy a $5 pair, drive over them with my car a few times, and they'll still sound better and be more durable than these earbuds ever did.JBL, I never wanted to talk to you again, but you're about to hear from me. (Make sure you're not wearing the Vibe Buds!!)

For the price these are good. However, after a year of use, I noticed noticed bluetooth audio cutting out periodically which is frustrating and ruins music listening. Despite this, I would still recommend these.P.S buy a case!!! The JBL Vibe Buds case has some fragile corners that chip over time.

For the price, these are great. I like to keep a pair of headphones by my bed to listen to audiobooks or music in bed. I had to replace an old pair of airpods because they wouldn’t hold a charge longer than 30 minutes. My primary focus was battery life. I fall asleep with these JBLs in and in the morning they still have at least half battery after sitting out of the case all night long. Second want for ear buds was something better at noise canceling than airpods (husband snores). These are exceptional at noise cancelling and you don’t have to turn the volume up super loud to achieve it. Only complaint, and this is totally my fault, is that the rubber tips are slightly too large for my ears and they fall out a lot or make my ears sore. But they came with either replacement rubber tips or different sizes in the box when i got them and i threw them away. Since then ive been having a hard time finding generic replacement tips that don’t disrupt the charging on these. But like i said that’s on me. Anyways TL:DR baby best the price, excellent battery life, above average noise cancelling.

These are exceptional at noise cancelling and you don’t have to turn the volume up super loud to achieve it. Only complaint, and this is totally my fault, is that the rubber tips are slightly too large for my ears and they fall out a lot or make my ears sore. But they came with either replacement rubber tips or different sizes in the box when i got them and i threw them away. Since then ive been having a hard time finding generic replacement tips that don’t disrupt the charging on these. But like i said that’s on me. Anyways TL:DR baby best the price, excellent battery life, above average noise cancelling.

product_name: JBL Vibe Buds - True Wireless Earbuds, Smart Ambient, VoiceAware, Up to 32 Total Hours of Battery Life with Speed Charging, Water and dust Resistant, JBL Deep Bass Sound (Mint)

reviews.review: The headphones fit perfectly while also having really good bass and sound quality. But out of the box the sound is a little funky but after 5 minutes of use it returns back to normal and while getting really good sound quality and also have slot of battery life. I have been using them all day and it only got to around 80 percent on the JBL APP

I had to write this review after losing my old iOS Pro Buds and needing a new pair. These JBL Vibe Buds were on sale for $30, and I expected just okay for the price. But they’re amazing value. JBL has built solid products for years, and these are no exception. For $30, the sound is fantastic, and they stay in my ears without any issue—the default fit out of the box was perfect, and they arrived fully charged.The QR code for the JBL app is a nice touch, offering easy access to different sound settings. I’m an AI music creator, and these buds deliver some of the best sound I’ve heard, even compared to more expensive options.If I ever lose them again, I’ll definitely be buying another pair. Highly recommended

These work great, sound good, link up to Bluetooth easily.  But if you have them in your pocket or backpack and they separate from the charger, they can run out of battery, get lost or dirty.  I would highly recommend these for casual use.

These are eliteee, so basically yall im a gym girly and i usually go to the gym with my airpod pros but i left them somewhere and for someone who listens to music at work and etc i need to replace them quick, these are better than airpods!!! Bass is great, sound is clean, and they’re LOUD 10/10 get them also they dont have a top so that’s weird

This product is exceptionally excellent,  ive had this exactly a year to this date, amd ive had this in the toughest weather condition possible, and still functioning as new, great quality sound, I mean this things is excellent.  Love this high recommend this over any apple pods

DO NOT BUY THESE.These have been a problem from the start. The first pair I got, the audio squeaked and dropped every few seconds. They would barely work with Apple products, and they'd work okay with Microsoft products. I submitted for an exchange or refund WITHIN DAYS OF RECEIVING THEM, and Amazon rejected both. I then contacted JBL and started the process over. I very clearly explained that I had done all of the trouble shooting possible. I was told to try the troubleshooting again, as there was no other option. I told them I wasn't going to waste my time, and that they needed to make it right. I got no reply.A week later I got an email requesting a review of my service, HILARIOUS. I let them know I received a defective product and was ignored by both Amazon and JBL. I told them you're welcome for the free money.I immediately got a reply apologizing and information to return the defective products, as well as a tracking number for the replacement pair.Unfortunately, the new pair has the same issues, although not as severely. I decided to keep them because wasn't interesting in spending more time begging to get what I'm owed. Aside from the audio issues, the casing on these have begun to chip off. These headphones sit on my desk all day. They do not get jostled inside of a bag or moved around whatsoever.I've had these second pair almost a year, and now they work even less then the original pair did. I'm going to go to the gas station and buy a $5 pair, drive over them with my car a few times, and they'll still sound better and be more durable than these earbuds ever did.JBL, I never wanted to talk to you again, but you're about to hear from me. (Make sure you're not wearing the Vibe Buds!!)

For the price these are good. However, after a year of use, I noticed noticed bluetooth audio cutting out periodically which is frustrating and ruins music listening. Despite this, I would still recommend these.P.S buy a case!!! The JBL Vibe Buds case has some fragile corners that chip over time.

For the price, these are great. I like to keep a pair of headphones by my bed to listen to audiobooks or music in bed. Anyways TL:DR baby best the price, excellent battery life, above average noise cancelling.

product_name: JBL Tune 230NC TWS - True Wireless In-Ear Headphones, Active Noise Cancelling with Smart Ambient, JBL Pure Bass Sound, 4 mics for perfect voice calls, IPX4, 40Hrs of battery life (Black)

reviews.review: i used my last pair for five years, i think it was. the first thing that went was the charging - they didn't charge in the case. so i had to charge the earbuds by charging the case. then the case didn't charge as well anymore. then the battery of the earbuds declined so i only had maybe an hour of noise cancellation, which is my primary reason for using these. then they stopped pairing so well, and then ultimately one earbud stopped working altogether. so i bought another pair! these are worth buying when they're on sale the two times a year they go on sale. camelcamelcamel.com can tell you exactly by copying and pasting their URL.these have the best sound quality ever. the bass is AMAZING and makes all the difference for me. the other aspects of the quality are also incredible and the noise cancellation is the best i've tried so far. would definitely recommend - and have! my dad bought them as well, and he's very very picky about comfort. he always complains about how they fit in his ears. but he likes these and he is willing to work out with them as well.
Sound is really good. Also comes with different size cushions and is very comfortable in the ear. Haven’t had any issues and it stays charged for a long time

Updated 1 year later: I'm dropping my 5 stars to 4 stars. I still enjoy these headphones. And the battery is still good. After about an hour or so, my ears will start to get sore, but it's not too bad. They do cut out for about 1 sec maybe every 20 mins or so, but for the price I paid, I'm still pretty happy with them.I had not had a chance to really compare them with others until recently. We bought my dad for his birthday the Sony WF-1000XM5. They are double the price of these JBLs. He was having trouble with them so I took them for a week to find out what he was doing wrong (nothing was wrong - he wasn't wearing them correctly). While I was testing them, didn't cut out, and the sound, comfort, ambient aware and noise cancelling features were incredible. Sony's were 10x better than the JBLs.Bottom line: If you want a decent pair of noise cancelling earbuds without paying a fortune, I do believe, for the price, these JBLs are still a good buy. I liked being able to finally compare them, though, to another brand. Hope this helps.Previous post:I am super impressed with the noise canceling on these earbuds. I was looking for earbuds that had a good balance of comfort and noise cancelling and decent sound. With all the earbuds I have bought in the past I never found ones that were good at canceling the loud noise of plane engines when flying and I was always turning the sound up super loud just to hear the music. These earbuds are comfortable and did a fantastic job of canceling the background noise. I also really like the "ambient aware" function that allows me to turn off the noise canceling when my wife was talking next to me on the plane and I didn't have to take the earbuds out to hear her. I'm not an expert by any means, but I feel these $100 earbuds cancel out noise as well as some of the other more pricey $200-300+ over the ear brands I have played around with in stores that are big and bulky to carry around. The case is small and can fit in my pocket easily, and I can charge them while in my pocket. So when I have a layover flight, by time I got these out at my next flight gate or on the plane, they're ready to go. And I found them on sale on here for $50, which made it even better! I haven't tried these for working out or running yet so I can't say how they are with sweating and such. But for the casual wearer who would use them for something like traveling, these are DEFINITELY worth it! I highly recommend them.

I have one pair for work and one for home/going out. I wouldn’t have spent $100 on each pair but at $50 per pair they’re a good deal.The ANC is pretty impressive for little earbuds.  Makes the background sounds in an IHOP at 9:30 on a Sunday nearly disappear. They also eliminate the sound of snoring dogs and humans.Took a recent trip on an airplane and opted to bring these instead of my Sennheiser Momentum 3’s.  I’m an audiophile on a budget. They can’t compete with the over-ear Momentum for sound reproduction. But for earbuds they’re a great product at the sale price.There is a JBL app you can download to your smartphone but the controls are reasonably intuitive. I have big fingers so I probably miss the sweet-spot for function control more than the average person. I’ve found the bass to be a little lacking but I think that’s due to the EQ setting I’ve selected.  You do have some EQ presets to choose between in the app.They come with three sets of the rubber earplugs for various sizes of ear-canals. Medium worked for me. I can use them to sleep, travel, shut out the loud noises in restaurants, and for Zoom calls.Consider the color you want to stand out against your bedding when they fall out if falling asleep with them in.I like them enough that I bought a second, dedicated pair for work.The ANC has three settings but so far I haven’t found one that totally mutes audio output from your device in the “ambient-aware” or “talk through” modes. That’s a feature I like on my Momentum. It can be accomplished by the extra step of just pausing playback with a tap on the right, then tap the left to toggle through the three ANC modes.They work great with an iPhone as well as Windows 10/11 computers.Much greater clarity the the JLAB go, which don’t seem to have any functional ANC.  I should have spent the extra money at the get-go.Buy them when on sale. They’ll probably be fine for you.If ANC and a variety of EQ options are the most important features for you, spring for the current $300 - $400 Sony over-ears. I have a pair of those in the house-too. Their ANC is better but for the music I listen to the Sennheisers are #1.  However I would recommend the Sonys for over-ear for the average listener and these for travel, etc.  it’s a lot harder to lose a big set of cans than earbuds so I don’t want to invest too much in these little guys.JBL has always served me pretty well for the price in the pro-audio and live sound amplification area so I had some confidence in the name when I bought these.

While I was testing them, didn't cut out, and the sound, comfort, ambient aware and noise cancelling features were incredible. Sony's were 10x better than the JBLs.Bottom line: If you want a decent pair of noise cancelling earbuds without paying a fortune, I do believe, for the price, these JBLs are still a good buy. I liked being able to finally compare them, though, to another brand. Hope this helps.Previous post:I am super impressed with the noise canceling on these earbuds. I was looking for earbuds that had a good balance of comfort and noise cancelling and decent sound. With all the earbuds I have bought in the past I never found ones that were good at canceling the loud noise of plane engines when flying and I was always turning the sound up super loud just to hear the music. These earbuds are comfortable and did a fantastic job of canceling the background noise. I also really like the "ambient aware" function that allows me to turn off the noise canceling when my wife was talking next to me on the plane and I didn't have to take the earbuds out to hear her. I'm not an expert by any means, but I feel these $100 earbuds cancel out noise as well as some of the other more pricey $200-300+ over the ear brands I have played around with in stores that are big and bulky to carry around. The case is small and can fit in my pocket easily, and I can charge them while in my pocket. So when I have a layover flight, by time I got these out at my next flight gate or on the plane, they're ready to go. And I found them on sale on here for $50, which made it even better! I haven't tried these for working out or running yet so I can't say how they are with sweating and such. But for the casual wearer who would use them for something like traveling, these are DEFINITELY worth it! I highly recommend them.

I have one pair for work and one for home/going out. I wouldn’t have spent $100 on each pair but at $50 per pair they’re a good deal.The ANC is pretty impressive for little earbuds.  Makes the background sounds in an IHOP at 9:30 on a Sunday nearly disappear. They also eliminate the sound of snoring dogs and humans.Took a recent trip on an airplane and opted to bring these instead of my Sennheiser Momentum 3’s.  I’m an audiophile on a budget. They can’t compete with the over-ear Momentum for sound reproduction. But for earbuds they’re a great product at the sale price.There is a JBL app you can download to your smartphone but the controls are reasonably intuitive. I have big fingers so I probably miss the sweet-spot for function control more than the average person. I’ve found the bass to be a little lacking but I think that’s due to the EQ setting I’ve selected.  You do have some EQ presets to choose between in the app.They come with three sets of the rubber earplugs for various sizes of ear-canals. Medium worked for me. I can use them to sleep, travel, shut out the loud noises in restaurants, and for Zoom calls.Consider the color you want to stand out against your bedding when they fall out if falling asleep with them in.I like them enough that I bought a second, dedicated pair for work.The ANC has three settings but so far I haven’t found one that totally mutes audio output from your device in the “ambient-aware” or “talk through” modes. That’s a feature I like on my Momentum. It can be accomplished by the extra step of just pausing playback with a tap on the right, then tap the left to toggle through the three ANC modes.They work great with an iPhone as well as Windows 10/11 computers.Much greater clarity the the JLAB go, which don’t seem to have any functional ANC.  I should have spent the extra money at the get-go.Buy them when on sale. They’ll probably be fine for you.If ANC and a variety of EQ options are the most important features for you, spring for the current $300 - $400 Sony over-ears. I have a pair of those in the house-too. Their ANC is better but for the music I listen to the Sennheisers are #1.  However I would recommend the Sonys for over-ear for the average listener and these for travel, etc.  it’s a lot harder to lose a big set of cans than earbuds so I don’t want to invest too much in these little guys.JBL has always served me pretty well for the price in the pro-audio and live sound amplification area so I had some confidence in the name when I bought these.

product_name: JBL Vibe Beam - True Wireless JBL Deep Bass Sound Earbuds, Bluetooth 5.2, Water & Dust Resistant, Hands-free call with VoiceAware, Up to 32 hours of battery life (Black)

reviews.review: Sound proof af and barely ever need charging. I got these for my husband about a year ago and he uses them every single day for his job events. They never die on him! He said he only charges them about once a week and uses them for about 3-4 hours a day. He let me use them during the first month our newborn came home and they saved my life since our baby had colic. They are also very compact so they fit inside of his pocket perfectly, even with a case. The bass quality is superb for such little buds too. Definitely worth the price and after a year they havnt lost any quality in sound.

I rarely write reviews...but I have to rave about these.These are some of the best earbuds I have owned.I bought a pair of $160 Nothing headphones before this and these beat those out.-Great Bass-Super customizable settings-Comfortable in the ear-Responsive-Great battery life-"Find my earbud" featureI feel like I will never go back to any other type of buds.

They connected to my phone quite easily. The sound is excellent. However, they sometimes fall out of my ears; I might need to try different earbuds. The quality is excellent. The charge lasts quite a long time, even with frequent use.

The Good:1. I paid $24 for these back in November of '24 as part of a Black Friday special and am quite happy with the purchase.2. They sound really, really good -- but only when I apply pressure to them, push them into my ears and hold them.3. I dropped one into a sink full of water for two or three seconds (totally submerged). I expected it to die but it still played! (Another time sweat ran down into my ear and conked it out for the evening.)4. The free JBL Headphones app has an equalizer, as well as some other features, which will allow you to make some adjustments to the sound ( I tried it but didn't notice a big difference and ended up uninstalling it to free up memory).5. Some people claim you can mold your own earbud tips and improve the fit and sound quality.The Bad:1. They don't fit snuggly. I tried the different sized rubber ear tips that came with it and none of them are quite right.2. The sound is very thin. This is 100% a fit issue. Shove them in and hold them and they sound really good.3. When the batteries get low you get an audible "battery is low" message. Fine but as the battery gets lower, the message eventually stats coming every twenty seconds or so (maybe faster). It's quite annoying.4. Getting them in and out of the case is somewhat of a PITA due to some design issues.

This review is about the audio features of the JBL Vibe Beam earbuds.I'm an audio engineer so audio quality is very important to me. As such, I use wired connections as much as possible to maintain the integrity of the audio signal.  However, many newer consumer-level products no longer have audio jacks, so I finally decided to invest in some wireless earbuds as a backup to the other earphones and headphones that I use.  I didn't want to spend a lot of money as I didn't foresee myself using this product very much, and since this is my first foray into wireless audio earphones, if they were just ok or they broke after a while, then I wouldn't feel too bad about the little money that I spent.  Also, I wanted to focus on finding wireless earbuds with excellent audio quality first as I already have an excellent high-end bluetooth earpiece for cell phone use, and I wouldn't be using this product as a bluetooth headset for my phone.After doing much research, I chose the JBL Vibe Beam's as they were at my price point, I'm familiar with JBL products, and I could reasonably expect that they were likely deliver the high audio quality that I've come to expect from JBL products.  In my research, I read reviews that complained about the harshness of the high end with high frequency instruments like cymbals or the lack of bass, so I was a bit concerned.When I received and started listening to my JBL Vibe Beams I understood what people were talking about.  However, to correct the issues, first, one must have a great fit of the earbuds in their ears.  I'm fortunate, in that with the medium tips that were already installed on the Vibe Beams, they made a snug fit in my ears right out of the box.  If you find that these earbuds do not fit well in your ears it might be worthwhile to invest in a separate set of variable sized earbud tips, or try tips from one of your other well-fitting earbuds, if you have them.  Once the earbuds were seated properly in my ear, that took care of the poor bass issue. (I have not worn them long-term so I can't speak to them falling out of my ear, as others have mentioned, but they seem to stay in pretty well.)For the misaligned frequency response issue, fortunately, the JBL Headphone app that you can install on your cell phone includes a ten-band graphic equalizer that you can use to make adjustments to the frequency response of your earbuds.  After listening to several of the reference tracks I use to check new audio equipment or my mixes against, I found that the only adjustments needed were carving out some of the upper midrange and making a very slight boost in the bottom end of the lower frequency spectrum.  I've included a screenshot of my EQ curve which I based on the Bass preset in the JBL app.  You can't tell as there is no dB scale on the side, but I needed to cut or boost by only 1-2 dB.  I find that my new EQ curve gives a more balanced frequency response than what came out of the box, and matches up well against the reference speaker system and headphones that I use for my audio mixing and mastering work.  I invite you to use my EQ curve as a starting point and adjust as sounds best to you.I also read reviews complaining about the apparent lack of volume of the Vibe Beams.  I connected the JBL's to several different sources (phone, computer, TV, MP3 player, etc.) and I found that the overall maximum volume (with limiter off) is relatively lower than wired speaker versions.  However, the input to the JBL's is relative to the maximum output of the source itself.  I found that the loudest level I could get came from my iPhone and the lowest level output came from my MP3 player (which probably doesn't offer much output anyway being a tiny portable unit).  As a comparison, I did a side-by-side test of the JBL's with my wife's AirPods (2nd gen).  What I found was that the JBL's offered an almost identical audio output level as the AirPods with any of the sources I used so that confirmed that the output level of the JBL's has more to do with the source (and the source material as some songs are mastered at a lower volume than other songs) than with the earbuds themselves.  During my test, I put the JBL's at their maximum volume output (one tap at a time on the left bud to raise the volume).  Also, I noticed during my testing that the AirPods had a pleasing midrange sound perfect for listening to podcasts or watching video, but the JBL's excelled at full-range sound on the bottom and top ends of the frequency spectrum which made them sound much better over all and well-suited for music or listening to explosive action scenes in movies.And speaking of movies, the JBL app has a switchable audio/video mode.  The video mode reduces the latency of the delivery of audio against picture, so there isn't a noticeable lip-sync issue with dialogue in a scene.  However, there is a slight degradation in the audio quality of 'video' mode versus 'audio' mode, but you will have to make the determination if the change in audio quality is acceptable to you.As a side note, I included a picture of the inner side of the earbuds.  The 'L' and 'R' designations on the earbuds are tiny as you can see, plus they are the same color as the earbuds themselves, so they are very hard to see.  I wish JBL had made the L/R letters bigger or at least made them a different color so they would be easier to see.The pairing process was fairly easy with all my bluetooth-capable devices and the range was good, only dropping out after walking approximately 60-70 feet from the source.  There was one momentary dropout during my listening but that could be due to my wife using her AirPods the same time as I was using the JBL's.I can't speak to the other features of the JBL Vibe Beams as I don't intend to use them, but as far as audio quality goes, with just a few minor tweaks, these bluetooth earbuds can go from sounding like a $50 pair of earbuds to a $500 pair of reference earphones.

These are the best earbuds and have amazing sound. The color is very good and with the USBC charging it is very compatible with everything. They fit comfortably in my ear and have a very good battery life.

product_name: JBL Quantum TWS True Wireless Noise Cancelling Gaming Earbuds - Black (Renewed)

reviews.review: Update for an update: I contacted JBL support and they were very helpful. There was an update that showed up for the buds using the windows Quantum Engine application that did not show up from JBL Headphones on my phone. After updating, everything is working great. These things sound amazing!Update: May have spoke too soon. I'll check with JBL and see what's up. The 2.4ghz dongle worked great with my Oculus the first time I used it. The next day, I could only get audio in the left ear. Tried with my cell through the dongle, same issue. Factory reset on headphones didn't change it. Seems like the dongle is probably faulty and could have passed inspection.Original:I just received these earbuds today, your mileage may very, but I'm almost certain mine were completely new, never opened. There is literally no signs that the package has ever been opened. Down to the tape on the box that if you don't cut, will tear the box.If you do get a pair that even gives you the idea that you may not find our issues until after the return window, just return them and get another renewed pair... The savings here is amazing if you end up with a good pair of buds. And these are some of the best buds I've owned to date, hands down.

I've been using these for a few days now and I can honestly say that I really enjoy them. They definitely have their pros and cons as with any earbuds, but the cons stop these from reaching a 5 star rating for me.- Sound Quality: These earbuds sound great in all modes. The audio is crystal clear and you can clearly make out all sounds in a game or all instruments in music. They lean a bit towards being bass-heavy, but you can change that in the app/software that pairs with them. The active noise cancellation isn't as strong as some other options out there, but it's certainly passable.- Mic Quality: The mic is nothing special on these. Your friends/coworkers will be able to make out what you're saying, but the quality is nowhere near that of a headset or dedicated mic.- Battery Life: My biggest complaint is the battery life. On a full charge, they'll go for 3-5 hours. On the bright side, they charge relatively quickly in the case.- Connectivity: Bluetooth and the 2.4 GHz dongle work as you'd expect them to. Bluetooth is notoriously laggy on Windows, so with the dongle, games are actually playable without too much latency. There is still some, but it's miles better than trying to suffer through Bluetooth latency in a game.- Ease of use: The instructions are very clear and helpful, but the controls themselves aren't very obvious or intuitive. I find myself referring to the instruction manual for some of the functions that I use less frequently.I'd say these are absolutely worth it for the sale price of $75, but I can't see myself spending $150 on these. If you're looking for a lower latency 2.4 GHz connection, these are probably the best option out there currently.

There was a problem getting the product as promised. The courier missed the scheduled delivery date by 5 days.As for the JBLs, this us a must buy.  Excellent sound quality, battery life and microphone is excellent.  The certified refurbished worked as good as the New.  I could not tell the difference.  The seller was quick to respond to all of my comments about shipping.  I was a bit of a butt head, but the seller remained professional and helpful.

The JBL earbuds are fabulous, except they only hold a charge for two of the 8 hours as described in the post. The first set and the second set replacements are both the same. We will be returning this second pair of earbuds as well, as they do not meet the description.

I ordered at a significantly discounted rate. One of the selling features was the dongle. The quality of sound is pretty average, but the noise cancelling was superior. I drove at 70+ mph on the highway with windows open and heard no wind while listening to podcasts and music. Great product from a quality brand!
The battery runs out in less than 2 hours. There is not enough charge to watch even one movie.I highly do not recommend buying

I wanted a pair of wireless earbuds for gaming on a windows PC, requirements:- wireless earbuds rather than wireless headset, because I don't like pressure on my head for long hours- 2.4Ghz USB dongle rather than bluetooth. The last time I tried bluetooth for this purpose, I could never get the mic + audio to work correctly. This is something apple bluetooth airpods handle seamlessly- noise-cancelling would be niceI chose this pair because I hoped JBL would be better than some of the no-name chinese brands on Amazon. It generally fulfilled my requirements above, but had a bunch of issues that caused me to return them:- battery life! Claims 8 hours, I get <2 hours, which means it starts running out after 2 dota sessions. Really not usable- randomly when I put them on, one side doesn't work, and I need to put that side back in the case, and take it out again, really annoying- the touch controls are confusing as heck. When just putting them on, I'll often accidentally mute, or turn on ambient aware, or turn off noise cancelling. And I have no idea how to undo those via touch. I need to use their clunky app to figure out what settings are on, and set them straight.- earbuds are weirdly shaped such that they fall out on their own often.Overall, not a particularly well thought out product
Great sound
